title: Corporate Financial Management
text:
Welcome to the intensive block delivery of Corporate Financial Management at Ulster University. This website contains all materials for the 4-day course structure.


This module integrates financial management concepts with managerial decision-making, corporate planning, and interaction with the wider business environment. The course is delivered in an intensive 4-day block format, condensing a full semester of content into a comprehensive, focused learning experience.



The course is organised into four intensive days:



Morning: Financial framework, business objectives, agency theory, and ratio analysis
Afternoon: Capital investment decisions, appraisal techniques, and risk assessment
View Day 1 Materials



Morning: Long and short-term financing sources, equity and debt characteristics
Afternoon: Cost of capital, WACC, and capital structure decisions
View Day 2 Materials



Morning: Dividend theories, policy decisions, and practical considerations
Afternoon: Working capital management, cash, inventory, and credit management
View Day 3 Materials



Morning: Integrated case studies and financial analysis applications
Afternoon: Exam preparation, key concept revision, and practice questions
View Day 4 Materials





By completing this module, you will be able to:

Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of investment, financing and dividend decisions
Assess the potential and significance of various sources of finance available to a business
Critically examine issues surrounding corporate financing and dividend policy
Recognize concepts and theories of financial management




This module is assessed through two components:

Coursework (50%): Case study analysis due 07 June 2025
Examination (50%): 3-hour online exam during the exam period (Date TBC)







Atrill, P. (2019) Financial Management for Decision Makers. 9th ed. London: FT Prentice Hall.
